title: Installing and Managing _Bioconductor_ Packages

Current Bioconductor packages available ‘release’ version intended every-day use, ‘devel’ version new features introduced. new release version created every six months. Using BiocManager package helps users install packages release.

title: Installing and Managing _Bioconductor_ Packages
text: Package updates often include bug fixes, improvements functionality, optimizations. updating, user can ensure benefiting latest enhancements fixes packages use.

title: Installing and Managing _Bioconductor_ Packages
text: Bug Fixes: Updating packages can resolve known issues bugs present older versions. can lead accurate reliable analyses. Performance: Package updates might come performance optimizations can lead faster execution code analyses. New Features: Updated packages might introduce new features, functions, capabilities can enhance workflow analysis options. Compatibility: Newer packages often developed compatibility mind. Using outdated packages might lead compatibility issues packages R . Security: cases, package updates address security vulnerabilities. Keeping packages date can help maintain security computational environment. Documentation: Newer versions packages might come updated documentation reflects recent changes improvements package functionality.

title: Installing and Managing _Bioconductor_ Packages
text: Code Breakage: Updates can introduce changes package behavior, function signatures, syntax. can potentially break existing code relies previous behavior. Version Conflicts: Updates one package might trigger dependencies updated versions packages. can lead conflicts updated versions compatible parts workflow. Workflow Disruption: update packages, might need retest validate analyses ensure changes package behavior don’t affect results. Learning Curve: New features changes introduced updated packages might require invest time understanding use effectively. Temporary Instability: Right major update, new version might stable previous one, leading unexpected behavior.

title: Installing and Managing _Bioconductor_ Packages
text: Consider critical package analysis. package central workflow, updating might important. Read release notes package understand changes introduced update. Consider using separate environment (e.g., Docker container) testing updates applying main analysis environment. Make sure backup code data performing updates. Check compatibility issues packages using.

title: Installing and Managing _Bioconductor_ Packages
text: possible multiple versions Bioconductor installed computer. best practice create initial R installation. create use library version Bioconductor. library contain Bioconductor, CRAN, packages version Bioconductor. illustrate process assuming use Bioconductor version 3.7, available using R version 3.5 Create directory contain library (replace USER_NAME user name Windows) Linux: ~/R/3.5-Bioc-3.7 macOS: ~/Library/R/3.5-Bioc-3.7/library Windows: C:\Users\USER_NAME\Documents\R\3.5-Bioc-3.7 Set environment variable R_LIBS_USER directory, invoke R. Command line examples Linux Linux: R_LIBS_USER=~/R/3.5-Bioc-3.7 R macOS: R_LIBS_USER=~/Library/R/3.5-Bioc-3.7/library R Windows: cmd /C "set R_LIBS_USER=C:\Users\USER_NAME\Documents\R\3.5-Bioc-3.7 && R" R, confirm version-specific library path set Linux macOS, create bash alias save typing, e.g., Linux: alias Bioc3.7='R_LIBS_USER=~/R/3.5-Bioc-3.7 R' macOS: alias Bioc3.7='R_LIBS_USER=~/Library/R/3.5-Bioc-3.7/library R' Invoke command line Bioc3.7. Windows, create shortcut. Go Computer navigate directory PATH. right-click choose New->Shortcut. “type location item” box, put: Click “Next”. “Type name shortcut” box, type Bioc-3.7.
code: .libPaths() cmd /C "set R_LIBS_USER=C:\Users\USER_NAME\Documents\R\3.5-Bioc-3.7 && R"

title: Installing and Managing _Bioconductor_ Packages
text: Note managing multiple versions R Bioconductor important even Bioconductor versions use R version. Bioconductor libraries kept separate directories avoid conflicts packages. example, Bioconductor versions 3.7 3.8 use R version 3.5. manage packages versions, create two separate library directories. Using setup shown , second library directory : Linux: ~/R/3.5-Bioc-3.8 macOS: ~/Library/R/3.5-Bioc-3.8/library Windows: C:\Users\USER_NAME\Documents\R\3.5-Bioc-3.8 also convenient set separate alias shortcut version: Linux: alias Bioc3.8='R_LIBS_USER=~/R/3.5-Bioc-3.8 R' macOS: alias Bioc3.8='R_LIBS_USER=~/Library/R/3.5-Bioc-3.8/library R' Windows, create shortcut. Go Computer navigate directory PATH. right-click choose New->Shortcut. “type location item” box, put: Windows: cmd /C "set R_LIBS_USER=C:\Users\USER_NAME\Documents\R\3.5-Bioc-3.8 && R" Now two sets aliases shortcuts, one version Bioconductor. strategy can extended number versions Bioconductor long corresponding R version installed system. working separate R versions, path R executable must specified alias shortcut. Keep mind mixing packages different versions Bioconductor can lead unexpected behavior errors.

title: Installing and Managing _Bioconductor_ Packages
text: Offline use BiocManager possible organizations users like provide access internal repositories Bioconductor packages enforcing appropriate version checks Bioconductor R. offline use, organizations users require following steps: Use rsync create local repositories CRAN Bioconductor. Tell R repositories using (e.g., site-wide .Rprofile, see ?.Rprofile). Validate repository setting reviewing output repositories(). Create environment variable option, e.g., Use install.packages() bootstrap BiocManager installation. BiocManager can used subsequent installations, e.g., BiocManager::install(c("ggplot2", "GenomicRanges")).
code: options(     repos = c(CRAN_mirror = "file:///path/to/CRAN-mirror"),     BioC_mirror = "file:///path/to/Bioc-mirror" ) options(     BIOCONDUCTOR_ONLINE_VERSION_DIAGNOSIS = FALSE ) install.package(c("BiocManager", "BiocVersion"))

CRAN package know version Bioconductor use? BiocManager write information cache user disk, robust solution number reasons. way R keep track version information? Yes, installing Bioconductor package (BiocVersion) whose sole purpose indicate version Bioconductor use. default, BiocManager installs BiocVersion package corresponding recent released version Bioconductor version R use. time section written, recent version R R-3.6.1, associated Bioconductor release version 3.9. title: Access the Bioconductor Project Package Repository
text: BiocManager package, modern successor package BiocInstaller, allows users install manage packages Bioconductor project. Bioconductor focuses statistical analysis comprehension high-throughput genomic data. Current Bioconductor packages available ‘release’ version intended every-day use, ‘devel’ version new features continually introduced. new release version created every six months. Using BiocManager package helps users accurately install packages appropriate release. available() shows packages associated search pattern install() installs /updates packages either CRAN Bioconductor repositories() shows package repository URL endpoints valid() checks returns packages --date new version() returns current Bioconductor version number

title: Access the Bioconductor Project Package Repository
code: if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE))     install.packages("BiocManager")

title: Access the Bioconductor Project Package Repository
code: BiocManager::version() #> [1] '3.15'

title: Access the Bioconductor Project Package Repository
code: BiocManager::install(c("GenomicRanges", "SummarizedExperiment"))

title: Access the Bioconductor Project Package Repository
code: BiocManager::valid() #> [1] TRUE

text: Please see package vignette detailed information changing Bioconductor version, offline use, advanced usage.

title: Access the Bioconductor Project Package Repository

what: Install or update Bioconductor, CRAN, or GitHub packages — BiocManager-package
title: Install or update Bioconductor, CRAN, or GitHub packages — BiocManager-package
text: package provides tools managing Bioconductor packages manner consistent Bioconductor's package versioning release system.

title: Install or update Bioconductor, CRAN, or GitHub packages — BiocManager-package
text: Main functions follows; additional help available function, e.g., ?BiocManager::version. BiocManager::install(): Install update packages Bioconductor, CRAN, GitHub. BiocManager::version(): Report version Bioconductor use. BiocManager::available(): Return character() vector package names available (BiocManager::repositories()) installation. BiocManager::valid(): Determine whether installed packages version Bioconductor. BiocManager::repositories(): Bioconductor repository URLs discover packages installation. version Bioconductor use determined installed version second package, BiocVersion. BiocVersion installed automatically first use BiocManager::install(). BiocVersion yet installed, version determined code base R. Options influencing package behavior (see ?options, ?getOption) include: "repos", "BiocManager.check_repositories": URLs additional repositories use BiocManger::install(). See ?repositories. "pkgType": default type packages downloaded installed; see ?install.packages. "timeout": maximum time allowed download single package, seconds. BiocManager increases 300 seconds accommodate download large BSgenome packages. System environment variables influencing package behavior include: BIOCONDUCTOR_ONLINE_VERSION_DIAGNOSIS advanced configuration avoid Bioconductor version checks. See ?install. BIOCONDUCTOR_CONFIG_FILE offline use BiocManager versioning functionality. See ?install. BIOCONDUCTOR_USE_CONTAINER_REPOSITORY opt binary package installations. See ?containerRepository. BIOCMANAGER_CHECK_REPOSITORIES silence messages regarding non-standard CRAN Bioconductor repositories. See ?repositories. BIOCMANAGER_SITE_REPOSITORY configure permanent site_repository input repositories(). See ?repositories. R_BIOC_VERSION use specific, possibly unsupported, version Bioconductor. install(), version(), available(), valid(), repositories() use version without checking consistent version R use.

title: Install or update Bioconductor, CRAN, or GitHub packages — BiocManager-package
text: Maintainer: Marcel Ramos marcel.ramos@roswellpark.org (ORCID) Authors: Martin Morgan martin.morgan@roswellpark.org (ORCID)

what: Discover packages available for installation. — available
title: Discover packages available for installation. — available
text: function lists packages available repositories() pattern provided. usually includes CRAN Bioconductor packages. function can also used check package name availability. Common use cases include annotation package lookups organism short name (e.g., "hsapiens").

title: Discover packages available for installation. — available
code: available(pattern = "", include_installed = TRUE)

title: Discover packages available for installation. — available
text: pattern character(1) pattern filter (via grep(pattern=...)) available packages; filter case sensitive. include_installed logical(1) TRUE, include installed packages list available packages; FALSE, exclude installed packages.

title: Discover packages available for installation. — available
text: character() vector package names available installation.

title: Discover packages available for installation. — available
code: if (interactive()) {   avail <- BiocManager::available()   length(avail)    BiocManager::available("bs.*hsapiens") }

what: Install or update Bioconductor, CRAN, and GitHub packages — install
title: Install or update Bioconductor, CRAN, and GitHub packages — install
text: BiocManager::install() function installs updates Bioconductor CRAN packages Bioconductor release. Upgrading new Bioconductor release may require additional steps; see https://bioconductor.org/install.

title: Install or update Bioconductor, CRAN, and GitHub packages — install
code: install(   pkgs = character(),   ...,   site_repository = character(),   update = TRUE,   ask = TRUE,   checkBuilt = FALSE,   force = FALSE,   version = BiocManager::version() )

title: Install or update Bioconductor, CRAN, and GitHub packages — install
text: pkgs character() vector package names install update.  missing value updates installed packages according update = ask =. Package names containing '/' treated GitHub repositories installed using remotes::install_github(). ... Additional arguments used install.packages(). site_repository (Optional) character(1) vector representing additional repository look packages install. repository prepended default repositories (can see BiocManager::repositories()). update logical(1). FALSE, BiocManager::install() attempt update old packages. TRUE, update old packages according ask. ask logical(1) indicating whether prompt user installed packages updated.  TRUE, user can choose whether update outdated packages without prompting, pick packages update, cancel updating (non-interactive session, packages updated unless ask = FALSE). checkBuilt logical(1). TRUE package built earlier major.minor version R (e.g., 3.4) considered old. force logical(1). TRUE re-download package currently --date. version character(1) Bioconductor version install, e.g., version = "3.8". special symbol version = "devel" installs current 'development' version.

title: Install or update Bioconductor, CRAN, and GitHub packages — install
text: BiocManager::install() returns pkgs argument, invisibly.

title: Install or update Bioconductor, CRAN, and GitHub packages — install
text: Installation Bioconductor CRAN packages use R's standard functions library management – install.packages(), available.packages(), update.packages(). Installation GitHub packages uses remotes::install_github(). installing CRAN Bioconductor packages, typical arguments include: lib.loc, passed old.packages() used determine library location installed packages updated; lib, passed install.packages{} determine library location pkgs installed. installing GitHub packages, ... passed remotes package functions install_github() remotes:::install(). typical use build vignettes, via dependencies=TRUE, build_vignettes=TRUE. See ?repositories additional detail customizing BiocManager searches package installation. BIOCONDUCTOR_ONLINE_VERSION_DIAGNOSIS environment variable global options() , set FALSE, allows organizations users use offline repositories BiocManager enforcing appropriate version checks Bioconductor R. Setting BIOCONDUCTOR_ONLINE_VERSION_DIAGNOSIS FALSE can speed package loading internet access slow non-existent, may result --date information regarding current release development versions Bioconductor. addition, offline organizations users set BIOCONDUCTOR_CONFIG_FILE environment variable option .yaml file similar https://bioconductor.org/config.yaml full offline use version validation.

title: Install or update Bioconductor, CRAN, and GitHub packages — install
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ## update previously installed packages BiocManager::install()  ## install Bioconductor packages, and prompt to update all ## installed packages BiocManager::install(c("GenomicRanges", "edgeR"))  ## install a CRAN and Bioconductor packages: BiocManager::install(c("survival", "SummarizedExperiment"))  ## install a package from source: BiocManager::install("IRanges", type="source") } # }

Setting type "source" disable Bioconductor binary packages specifically built containers.

title: Display current Bioconductor and CRAN repositories. — repositories
code: BiocManager::repositories() #> 'getOption("repos")' replaces Bioconductor standard repositories, see #> 'help("repositories", package = "BiocManager")' for details. #> Replacement repositories: #>     CRAN: https://cran.rstudio.com #>                                                      BioCsoft  #>                 "https://bioconductor.org/packages/3.20/bioc"  #>                                                       BioCann  #>      "https://bioconductor.org/packages/3.20/data/annotation"  #>                                                       BioCexp  #>      "https://bioconductor.org/packages/3.20/data/experiment"  #>                                                 BioCworkflows  #>            "https://bioconductor.org/packages/3.20/workflows"  #>                                                     BioCbooks  #>                "https://bioconductor.org/packages/3.20/books"  #>                                                          RSPM  #> "https://packagemanager.posit.co/cran/__linux__/noble/latest"  #>                                                          CRAN  #>                                    "https://cran.rstudio.com"  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ BiocManager::repositories(version="3.8") } # }  containerRepository() # character(0) if not within a Bioconductor container #> character(0)

title: Validate installed package versions against correct versions. — valid
code: valid(   pkgs = installed.packages(lib.loc, priority = priority),   lib.loc = NULL,   priority = "NA",   type = getOption("pkgType"),   filters = NULL,   ...,   checkBuilt = FALSE,   site_repository = character() )  # S3 method for class 'biocValid' print(x, ...)

title: Validate installed package versions against correct versions. — valid
text: pkgs character() vector package names checking, matrix returned installed.packages()`. lib.loc character() vector library location(s) packages validated; see installed.packages(). priority character(1) Check validity , "base", "recommended" packages; see installed.packages(). type character(1) type available package (e.g., binary, source) check validity ; see available.packages(). filters character(1) Filter available packages check validity ; see available.packages(). ... Additional arguments, passed BiocManager::install() fix=TRUE. checkBuilt logical(1). TRUE package built earlier major.minor version R (e.g., 3.4) considered old. site_repository character(1). See ?install. x `biocValid` object returned `BiocManager::valid()`.
